actions.args: {"id": 110, "body": {"name": "Travel Reimbursement [REDACTED] IRL Bangkok 2024", "summary": "My name is Lorenzo Castagnone, a blockchain enthusiast and Web3 developer with over 4 years of experience. I have actively contributed to the NEAR ecosystem and recently won the Nearcon 23 pitching competition with our project, DeFi Builder. I am requesting travel reimbursement to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok, where I will continue building innovative solutions for the NEAR ecosystem.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "\\\\n\\\\n**NEAR Contributions & Achievements**  \\\\n- Winner of the pitching competition at Nearcon 23 with DeFi Builder, an AI-based tool for generating smart contract code on NEAR. [Project link](https://devpost.com/software/defi-builder).  \\\\n- Participated in multiple high-profile hackathons, winning several prizes.  \\\\n\\\\n**Hackathon Experience**  \\\\n- \\\\u{1f3c6} 1st Prize: Nearcon 23 Pitch Competition\\\\n- \\\\u{1f3c6} 1st Prize: MultiversX xDay 2023  \\\\n- \\\\u{1f3c6} 1st Prize: Neo X Grind Hackathon  \\\\n- \\\\u{1f3c6} 1st Prize: BNB Chain Q3 Hackathon  \\\\n- \\\\u{1f3c6} 1st Prize: ICP Balkans Ideathon  \\\\n- \\\\u{1f948} 2nd Prize: Starknet Hackathon  \\\\n- \\\\u{1f3c6} 1st Prize: Fuel House  \\\\n- \\\\u{1f3c6} 1st Prize: Areon Network Hackathon  \\\\n\\\\n**Hackathon Project Plan**  \\\\nFor [REDACTED], I will focus on advancing Near Yield, a platform that utilizes AI for smart DeFi investment opportunities on over 110 blockchains. Our goal is to simplify cross-chain investments while maintaining full user control over assets, all powered by NEAR\\\\\\'s chain abstraction and intelligent AI-based yield matching.\\\\nNearYield submitted project on devpost: https://devpost.com/software/near-yield\\\\n\\\\n**Travel Itinerary and Estimated Costs**  \\\\n- **Departure:** Rome, Italy \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand  \\\\n- **Return:** Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Rome, Italy  \\\\n\\\\n**Estimated Costs Breakdown:**  \\\\n- **Flights:** $750 USD  \\\\n\\\\n**Why Support My Participation**  \\\\n- Proven track record of delivering impactful blockchain solutions within the NEAR ecosystem, including winning the Nearcon 23 pitching competition.  \\\\n- Extensive experience in hackathons, consistently delivering innovative projects.  \\\\n- Committed to driving forward DeFi solutions that enhance user accessibility and yield optimization through AI-powered tools.  \\\\n\\\\n**Links**  \\\\n- DeFi Builder: [https://app.defibuilder.com/](https://app.defibuilder.com/)  \\\\n- DeFi Builder AI: [https://ai.defibuilder.com/](https://ai.defibuilder.com/)  \\\\n- Near Yield: [https://devpost.com/software/near-yield](https://devpost.com/software/near-yield)  \\\\n\\\\nThank you for considering my request for travel reimbursement to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon. Your support will enable me to further contribute to the NEAR ecosystem and showcase innovative solutions on a global stage.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "894a4d5af3a3b35498a998dc681eeea528437d893d6feff7bddd8d33a062c77c", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "750", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses", "Hackathon"]}

{"body": {"name": "BuildLink team expenses for [REDICTED] HACKATHON Bangkok Nov 9 - 11", "summary": "Build Links is an innovative AI-Blockchain project developed on the NEAR Protocol, aimed at bridging Web3 and Web2 by enabling users to interact with blockchain functionalities through an AI-powered chat interface. By simplifying access to on-chain actions, Build Links enhances the user experience for decentralized applications.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "#### Overview:\\\\n[Build Link](https://buildlink.vercel.app/) is our innovative project designed to bring the power of blockchain into everyday communication. Built on the NEAR Protocol, Build Link uses AI to create seamless, interactive on-chain experiences within a chat interface, simplifying access to blockchain features for both seasoned Web3 users and newcomers.\\\\n#### Example:\\\\nBob: \\\\\\\"I want to transfer 2 NEAR to alice.near.\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\nThe AI will interpret this request and generate an interactive user interface (UI) directly within the chat. With a simple click, Bob can confirm the transaction, opening a wallet modal where he can securely sign and complete the transfer. This streamlined approach eliminates the need to navigate complex Web3 interfaces, making blockchain interactions as simple as chatting.\\\\n\\\\n####  On-Chain Interactions in Chat\\\\nUsers can perform a variety of on-chain operations right from the chat interface. Build Links supports:\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Transfers \\\\u{2013} Instantly transfer NEAR tokens to other users.\\\\n- NFT Minting \\\\u{2013} Mint NFTs directly with a single command.\\\\n- Staking \\\\u{2013} Stake tokens within the chat for passive income.\\\\n- Other On-Chain Operations \\\\u{2013} Any interaction that can be executed on-chain, such as governance votes or smart contract calls.\\\\n![https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreickdzryobxg37adrbv7ia4c7rz6hxvctea6pxlndldew6wknjzzd4](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreickdzryobxg37adrbv7ia4c7rz6hxvctea6pxlndldew6wknjzzd4)\\\\n##### AI-Powered UI Generation\\\\nThe AI generates the necessary UI for each request, reducing user input and enhancing accessibility. Users no longer need to switch between different platforms, as the chat AI handles and processes all requests in real-time.\\\\n\\\\n#### Seamless Web3-to-Web2 Transition\\\\nBuild Links integrates Web3 functionalities into a familiar Web2 chat experience. This accessibility lowers the entry barrier, making blockchain features easy to use even for those new to Web3.\\\\n\\\\n#### Request for Travel Stipend:\\\\nWe are seeking assistance with flights to Bangkok, which cost approximately $350 per person. We would also greatly appreciate staying at a NEAR Hackerhouse if available. If not, we request up to $200 per person for accommodation. We are not requesting any additional funds for food or miscellaneous expenses, as we plan to cover those ourselves.\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam\\\\n\\\\n#### Estimated breakdown:\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 3 students\\\\nRequest per student: $500 (Capping according to T&C)\\\\nTotal: $1500 (We can pay $1000 for ourselves)\\\\nTotal request: $500\\\\n\\\\n#### About Our Project: Frontend Flow and AI\\\\nAt Build Link, we\\\\u{2019}re passionate about making blockchain accessible and intuitive. Traditional Web3 interfaces can be complex, especially for users not familiar with decentralized technology. Our mission is to break down these barriers by creating a Web2-friendly interface where users can conduct complex blockchain operations as easily as sending a message.\\\\nExplore ours project apply to REDACTED Bangkok: https://buildlink.vercel.app/\\\\n\\\\n#### About my team:\\\\nHuynh Anh: Blockchain Engineer.\\\\nAnh Tuan: Software Engineer.\\\\nVuong: FullStack Developer\\\\n\\\\n#### Why We Need the Support?\\\\nAs students, we are managing most expenses on our own, but the flight costs present a challenge. This travel stipend would enable us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on building our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem, rather than worrying about travel logistics.\\\\n\\\\n#### Conclusion:\\\\nWe are excited about the opportunity to participate in the Bangkok hackathon and continue developing on NEAR. Your support would help us cover the necessary travel costs and allow us to concentrate on our project. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\n\\\\nTeam BuildLink", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "fastui.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Bounty", "Travel expenses", "Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 131446794}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @fastui.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}BuildLink team expenses for [REDICTED] HACKATHON Bangkok Nov 9 - 11\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nBuild Links is an innovative AI-Blockchain project developed on the NEAR Protocol, aimed at bridging Web3 and Web2 by enabling users to interact with blockchain functionalities through an AI-powered chat interface. By simplifying access to on-chain actions, Build Links enhances the user experience for decentralized applications.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=112)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 112, "snapshot": {"name": "BuildLink team expenses for [REDICTED] HACKATHON Bangkok Nov 9 - 11", "labels": ["Bounty", "Hackathon", "Travel expenses"], "summary": "Build Links is an innovative AI-Blockchain project developed on the NEAR Protocol, aimed at bridging Web3 and Web2 by enabling users to interact with blockchain functionalities through an AI-powered chat interface. By simplifying access to on-chain actions, Build Links enhances the user experience for decentralized applications.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "fastui.near", "timestamp": "1730175441548093064", "supervisor": null, "description": "#### Overview:\\\\n[Build Link](https://buildlink.vercel.app/) is our innovative project designed to bring the power of blockchain into everyday communication. Built on the NEAR Protocol, Build Link uses AI to create seamless, interactive on-chain experiences within a chat interface, simplifying access to blockchain features for both seasoned Web3 users and newcomers.\\\\n#### Example:\\\\nBob: \\\\\\\"I want to transfer 2 NEAR to alice.near.\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\nThe AI will interpret this request and generate an interactive user interface (UI) directly within the chat. With a simple click, Bob can confirm the transaction, opening a wallet modal where he can securely sign and complete the transfer. This streamlined approach eliminates the need to navigate complex Web3 interfaces, making blockchain interactions as simple as chatting.\\\\n\\\\n####  On-Chain Interactions in Chat\\\\nUsers can perform a variety of on-chain operations right from the chat interface. Build Links supports:\\\\n\\\\n- NEAR Transfers \\\\u{2013} Instantly transfer NEAR tokens to other users.\\\\n- NFT Minting \\\\u{2013} Mint NFTs directly with a single command.\\\\n- Staking \\\\u{2013} Stake tokens within the chat for passive income.\\\\n- Other On-Chain Operations \\\\u{2013} Any interaction that can be executed on-chain, such as governance votes or smart contract calls.\\\\n![https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreickdzryobxg37adrbv7ia4c7rz6hxvctea6pxlndldew6wknjzzd4](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreickdzryobxg37adrbv7ia4c7rz6hxvctea6pxlndldew6wknjzzd4)\\\\n##### AI-Powered UI Generation\\\\nThe AI generates the necessary UI for each request, reducing user input and enhancing accessibility. Users no longer need to switch between different platforms, as the chat AI handles and processes all requests in real-time.\\\\n\\\\n#### Seamless Web3-to-Web2 Transition\\\\nBuild Links integrates Web3 functionalities into a familiar Web2 chat experience. This accessibility lowers the entry barrier, making blockchain features easy to use even for those new to Web3.\\\\n\\\\n#### Request for Travel Stipend:\\\\nWe are seeking assistance with flights to Bangkok, which cost approximately $350 per person. We would also greatly appreciate staying at a NEAR Hackerhouse if available. If not, we request up to $200 per person for accommodation. We are not requesting any additional funds for food or miscellaneous expenses, as we plan to cover those ourselves.\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam\\\\n\\\\n#### Estimated breakdown:\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 3 students\\\\nRequest per student: $500 (Capping according to T&C)\\\\nTotal: $1500 (We can pay $1000 for ourselves)\\\\nTotal request: $500\\\\n\\\\n#### About Our Project: Frontend Flow and AI\\\\nAt Build Link, we\\\\u{2019}re passionate about making blockchain accessible and intuitive. Traditional Web3 interfaces can be complex, especially for users not familiar with decentralized technology. Our mission is to break down these barriers by creating a Web2-friendly interface where users can conduct complex blockchain operations as easily as sending a message.\\\\nExplore ours project apply to REDACTED Bangkok: https://buildlink.vercel.app/\\\\n\\\\n#### About my team:\\\\nHuynh Anh: Blockchain Engineer.\\\\nAnh Tuan: Software Engineer.\\\\nVuong: FullStack Developer\\\\n\\\\n#### Why We Need the Support?\\\\nAs students, we are managing most expenses on our own, but the flight costs present a challenge. This travel stipend would enable us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on building our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem, rather than worrying about travel logistics.\\\\n\\\\n#### Conclusion:\\\\nWe are excited about the opportunity to participate in the Bangkok hackathon and continue developing on NEAR. Your support would help us cover the necessary travel costs and allow us to concentrate on our project. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\n\\\\nTeam BuildLink", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "fastui.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "fastui.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "Red Flight Team => Travel Stipend [Redacted] - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "Red Flight is an AI Red Teaming NFT Game developed on the NEAR Protocol. As a leading AI Security & Safety company, we\\\\\\'ve created a platform where users can conduct AI red teaming exercises, participate in bug bounties, and tokenize successful attack strategies as NFTs. We\\\\\\'re expanding our impact through strategic partnerships, having recently concluded discussions with Meta\\\\\\'s VP Boon regarding a collaborative red teaming event with Meta Korea, while also engaging with Erica Kang from NEAR.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "# Red Flight: AI Red Teaming NFT Gaming Platform\\\\n\\\\n## Overview\\\\nRed Flight is our innovative AI Red Teaming NFT Game built on the NEAR Protocol. We\\\\\\'ve created a unique platform where AI security testing meets blockchain gaming, allowing users to conduct red teaming exercises and monetize their findings through NFTs, all while contributing to global AI safety standards.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## AI Security Gaming Features\\\\nOur platform supports various security testing operations:\\\\n* AI Red Teaming\\\\n* Bug Bounty Programs\\\\n* Attack Data NFT Minting\\\\n* Security Strategy Trading through NFT trading\\\\n\\\\nMore Detail info : https://devpost.com/software/red-flight?ref_content=user-portfolio&ref_feature=in_progress\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Request for Travel Stipend:\\\\nWe are seeking assistance with flights to Bangkok, which cost approximately $350 per person. We would also greatly appreciate staying at a NEAR Hackerhouse if available. And we request up to $200 per person for accommodation. \\\\n\\\\nDeparture: ICN, South Korea \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} ICN, South Korea\\\\n\\\\n## Estimated breakdown:\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 2 \\\\nRequest per person: $500 \\\\nTotal: $1,000 \\\\nTotal request: $1,000\\\\n\\\\n## About Our Team\\\\nOur award-winning team brings expertise in:\\\\n* AI Security & Safety\\\\n* Blockchain Development\\\\n* Game Design\\\\nEvent Participants : \\\\nYoujun Lee : Software Developer / CPO\\\\nHaon Park : AI Hacker\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion\\\\nRed Flight represents a significant advancement in AI security testing, combining the rigor of professional security assessment with the accessibility of gaming. By leveraging blockchain technology and NFTs, we\\\\\\'re creating a sustainable ecosystem that incentivizes and rewards contributions to AI safety.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n*Best regards,*  \\\\n*Team Red Flight*\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [109, 108, 107], "receiver_account": "youjun.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Meetup", "Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 131457238}

{"id": 97, "body": {"name": "Travel Stipend [REDACTED] Movement - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "As a contributor to the NEAR ecosystem from the very beginning, with my own experiments and to the DevHUB platform, I very much look forward to meet all the great people that I\\\\\\'m hacking together with on these projects every day. Also I have submitted the JsInRust+NearOpenAI proejct for the hackaton, and a speaker proposal for it as well ( including WebAssembly Music too ). For me being at Redacted Bangkok will have great value, and I hope also for others to meet me as well. ", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "# Purpose\\\\nI am applying for the overseas travel stipend of $1,575 to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok, Thailand.\\\\n\\\\n# My Records\\\\nI got involved into the NEAR ecosystem after my talk \\\\\\\"WebAssembly Music\\\\\\\" at the WebAssembly Summit 2020 ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C8j_ieOm4vE ), where the idea of music published in tiny WebAssembly files was launched. I made a proof of this by publishing the first music NFT on NEAR https://x.com/salomonsen_p/status/1369699664908410885, which also then lead me to NEARCON 2021 for speaking about the project https://youtu.be/2OgeSuACr2c?si=EjzDIPgkhml9HlHh\\\\n\\\\nAfter this I\\\\\\'ve had various projects on NEAR including the JSinRust project for combining the standard Rust smart contracts with Javascript for customizing. This is also the hackaton project that I\\\\\\'ve submitted https://devpost.com/software/jsinrust-nearopenai\\\\n\\\\nAnother project I\\\\\\'ve spent much time for, with the main purpose of tax reporting of income on NEAR is the Ariz Portfolio: https://arizportfolio.near.page/\\\\n\\\\nI am also a contributor to the DevHUB platform, and very much looking forward to meet my fellow contributors.\\\\n\\\\n# Travel itinerary and costs\\\\nI\\\\\\'m traveling from Sandefjord, Norway, flying directly from Oslo, Norway to Bangkok.\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\\\'ve already booked and paid for flight and hotel, so these are my expenses so far:\\\\n\\\\nEUR 1 076,01 = 1,169 USD ( 2024-10-12 )\\\\nNOK 4366,24 = 406 USD ( 2024-10-12 )\\\\n\\\\n**Total 1,575 USD**\\\\n\\\\n# Project plan\\\\nI am planning to hack on the JSInRust+NEAROpenAI project which you can read more about here: https://devpost.com/software/jsinrust-nearopenai\\\\n\\\\nI am also hoping to be able to present updates on the WebAssembly music project, the Ariz portfolio project and talk about what we\\\\\\'re hacking on with the DevHUB platform.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "petersalomonsen.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1575", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"]}
